wikipedia_page.main: Stuart Anthony Thurgood (born 4 November 1981) is an English former professional footballer.  He played professionally for clubs including Southend United and Gillingham.  In 2021 he was convicted of drugs smuggling offences and sentenced to eight years in prison.

response: In October 2007, Stuart was held in custody by Essex Police on suspicion of assault, in relation to an incident involving Chris Beardsley which resulted in Beardsley's jaw being broken in two places. The incident occurred during a match with York City on 22 September 2007. He was charged with grievous bodily harm in December 2007. He made a further 43 appearances for Grays during the season, failing to score. Following the departure of Stuart Thurgood to Gillingham in November 2007, Stuart was handed the captaincy for the remainder of the season, having previous served as vice-captain.
